Using View Manager on the Command Line (Cross-Platform Client)

On the Cross-Platform client, View Manager can be used to synchronize different views. For more information on View Manager capabilities, see Understanding the View Manager Utility.

View Manager can run as a command line utility or as an application with a graphical user interface. The command-line utility is faster, but the graphical user interface allows the user to preview what will be done as well as observe what has been done. In either case, View Manager requires JRE 1.3.

When you start View Manager from the command line, you can either postpone manual file merging or display a merge utility when View Manager finds a pair of files to be merged.

To start View Manager from the command line:

From any platform, use a command similar to the following, followed by the options you intend to use:

java -Xmx49201m -classpath "streplicate.jar:jhall.jar:starteam-sdk.jar" com.starbase.starteam.streplicate.streplicator

Depending on where you run the command and how your system is set up, you may need to replace "java" with the complete path to the JRE.

Important: Borland recommends using Java’s -Xmxn option in the command that runs the command-line interface. Replace n with a number that represents 80% of the total memory available on your computer.

Here is the documentation that Sun currently provides about this option:

-Xmxn: Specify the maximum size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. This value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 2MB. Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, or m or M to indicate megabytes. The default value is 64MB.
